p: Bacillus is the most common bacterial species identified as endophytes [ 29, 30]. The obtained results are compatible with those reported that found Bacillus spp. widely distributed as endophytic strains in various therapeutic plants, such as Glycyrrhiza spp., Pinellia ternata, Digitalis purpurae, Lycium chinense, Leonurus heterophyllus, Belamcanda chinensis, Bletilla striata, Pinellia pedatisecta, Taxus yunnanensis, Fagonia mollis, and Achillea fragrantissima [ 8, 31, 32, 33].
